question: Your Development Team is one of seven teams working on a product. All teams use the same version control system. Which is the best approach to deliver a high-quality Increment?

answers.text: Each team should have its own automated build.
Developers should perform a combination of local and private builds.
Each team's automated build is integrated toward the end of the Sprint.
There is one automated build for all teams.

question: Which statements are true when multiple Development Teams work on a software product at the same time? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: The Development Teams must integrate their work before the end of the Sprint.
They are all on the same Scrum Team.
Code is merged at the Scrum of Scrums.
All teams work in their own version control branch.
The different Development Teams coordinate their work to deliver a single Increment.

question: While practicing Test Driven Development, what is done after the test fails?

answers.text: Write the product code to satisfy the test.
Run it again to make sure it really fails.
Refactor the test so the code passes.
Meet with the business analyst to ensure that the test is correct.

question: Only technical writers can create documentation during a Sprint.

answers.text: true
false

question: Who writes tests in a Scrum Team?

answers.text: The Development Team
QA specialists
The Scrum Master
Coders

question: Which three of the following are code quality metrics? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: Cycle time per Product Backlog item.
Cyclomatic complexity
Class coupling
Unit tests per class
Number of check-ins per day
Depth of inheritance

question: What does Code Coverage show?

answers.text: The quality of unit tests being written.
When a feature is done.
The ratio of the number of tests to lines of code in the system being tested.
Code being exercised by tests.
The absence of defects in code.

question: Choose four desirable characteristcs of a unit test. (Choose 4 answers)

answers.text: Test code is as small as possible
Makes assertions about only one logical concept
Includes exercising the persistence layer
Execution is fast
Independent of others

question: A product increment must be released to production at the end of each Sprint.

answers.text: true
false

question: What are two differences between unit tests and integration tests? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: A unit test isolates a specific system behavior.
An integration test runs overnight.
An integration test may be composed of unit tests.
A unit test only runs on a developer's workstation.
A unit test is automated.

question: Which are the best three criteria to include in a Development Team's definiton of "Done"? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: Acceptance tests pass.
Code review is done.
The product is released at the end of every Sprint.
No impediments exist.
Regression tests pass.

question: While developing new functionality, you find a bug that has already been delivered to the customer. What do you do?

answers.text: Stub out the code that caused the bug so it no longer occurs.
Revise the tests so that the bug no longer appears on the bug report.
Fix the bug.
Talk to the Product Owner.

question: When should a Development Team create its first automated build?

answers.text: Just before the end of the Sprint
When the Product Owner askss for a build
As soon as there is code in the version control system
Just before the product is released
Before the first check-in

question: In software development, DRY refers to:

answers.text: Code with minimal duplication
Code that has not been peer reviewed
Code that has been peer reviewed
Code with low cyclomatic complexity

question: What activities would a Product Owner typically undertake in the phase between the end of the current Sprint and the start of the next Sprint?

answers.text: Update the project plan with stakeholders.
Refine the Product Backlog.
There is no such activities. The next Sprint starts immediately after the current Sprint.
Work with the QA departments on the Increment of the current Sprint.

question: When a Continuous Integration build fails, who ideally fixes it?

answers.text: The person assigned to the configuration management role within the team.
The tester responsible for validating builds.
The person who broke the build.
The next person who need the build to complete successfully.

question: What is pair programming?

answers.text: Managers doing performance reviews by comparing one programmer's code to another's.
Two programmers write code separately. A third programmer integrates the work.
The Scrum Team is divided into several two-person Development Teams that consolidate work in a Scrum of Scrums.
A developer and a tester work together to write and test code.
Two developers writing code together, providing constant peer review.

question: What are two ways a Development Team can ensure a good application architecture? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: The Development Team assigns someone to the role of software architect to provide architectural oversight.
The Development Team has a set of guiding architecture principles that every Development Team member understands and follows when writing code.
The Development Team uses a Spring 0 to create infrastructure that will be needed later.
The Development Team focuses only on adding funcionality. The architecture will take care of itself as the Development Team adds functionality.
Architecture is an ongoing discussion in the Development Team, focusing on implementing current Sprint Backlog items.

question: Which four are benefits of Test Driven Development? (Choose 4 answers)

answers.text: It causes you to construct a test harness that can be automated.
It reduces the cost of maintenance over time.
It promotes good design and separation of concerns.
It ensures no defects are present in the code.
It improves quality and reduces bugs.

question: Which are three attributes of a bad bug report? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: One bug per report
Assigning blame
Generic titles
Vague statements or untested assumptions
Simple and repeatable reproduction steps

question: Which four types of tests can be included in an automated test harness? (Choose 4 answers)

answers.text: Integration
Unit
Functional
Manual regression
Exploratory
Performance

question: Which are two benefits of establishing naming conventions for code? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: To reduce friction in a shared codebase.
To ensure that orphan are not created.
To communicate the identity of the developer  who worked on the code.
To make the code more readable.
To make it easy to distinguish between different software products.

question: Who should be present during Product Backlog refinement? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: Anyone interested in the backlog items
The Product Owner

The Development Team

question: What would NOT be considered refactoring?

Reordering method parameters to improve readability
Extracting methods

question: Which of the following describes an architecture spike?

question: Which three describe Test-Driven Development? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: A predictable way to develop working , clean code.
An incremental and emergent approach to software design.
Creating a manual test script before writing code.
A software development technique based on automated tests.

question: What is integration test?

answers.text: A test that runs during a Continuous Integration build
A test of multiple units of functionality
A test of a single unit of functionality
A test of the user interface

question: Why does a Development Team need a Sprint Goal?

answers.text: The Development Team is more focused with a common yet specific goal.
A sprint Goal only give purpose to Sprint 0.
Sprint Goals are not valuable. Everything is known from the Product Backlog.
A Spring Goal ensures that all of the Product Backlog items selected for the Sprint are implemented.

question: What is the practice of branching code a version control system?

answers.text: Tagging or labeling a particular codebase as ready for distribution
Combining two or more branches of code into a single codebase
Creating a copy of existing code, isolated from the original code
Releasing a specific codebase into a production environment

question: What is an INAPPROPRIATE activity for a Development Team member with special quality assurance skills?

answers.text: Define acceptance criteria for features.
Create a plan for testing the application.

question: What three things happen when refining Product Backlog items? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: Analysis
Product Backlog item decomposition
Design
Programming
Feature Testing

question: What does a test written with Test Driven Development represent?

answers.text: Something that completes the test coverage of a system.

question: What is static analysis?

answers.text: Analysis performed on software at runtime
Analysis performed on code

Work performed by a business analyst

question: The right time to refactor code using Test Driven Development is:

answers.text: After the test passes
After the test fails

question: What are some disadvantages of code coverage as a measurement for how well a system or product is tested? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: It does not measure usability.
It is too complicated to explain to management.
It only provides insights to programmers.
It could create incentives to write tests that simply increase code coverage, rather than tests that find bugs without increasing coverage.
It does not ensure that the most important or highest risk areas of the code are being exercised by tests.

question: Choose three reasons why architectural layering is important for emergent systems. (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: Layering separates different logical concerns within the system.
Layering increases maintainability of a system by isolating functional responsibilities.
Layering makes it easier to reuse functionality.
Layering assigns clear responsibilities to individual Development Team members.

question: Why is the Daily Scrum held at the same time and same place?

answers.text: Rooms are hard to book and this lets it be booked in advance.
The Product Owner demands it.
The place can be named.
The consistency reducess complexity.

question: A Scrum Team is only allowed to meet with stakeholders during Spring Review?

answers.text: true
false

question: Why might a Development Team choose to do pair programming?

answers.text: Information sharing and learning
It can be a fun way to work
Improving code quality
Efficiency
All of the above

question: Product documentation may be required as part of a working Increment.

answers.text: true
false

question: What is test first development?

answers.text: Testing existing code before adding more code to it.
Having the tester in the Development Team write the test plans before coding.
The continuous restructuring of software to retain flexibility.
Creating tests before satisfying them.

question: What is a unit test?

answers.text: A test that isolates and verifies individual units of functionality
A way to ensure product code satisfies the user requirements

A technique for ensuring that units of co-dependent systems integrate correctly

question: Who is responsible for the system architecture of a product developed using Scrum?

answers.text: The Development Team
The architect chosen by the Development Team
The software architect assigned to the Development Team
The Chief Architect

question: Based on "Sprint 7 Burn-Down Chart" would you do anything different in Sprint 8 ? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: The Scrum Master adds additional developers for Sprint 8.

The Development Team re-estimates incomplete Product Backlog Items and puts them back into the Product Backlog for re-ordering. The Product Owner may ask the Development Team to complete the unfinished Product Backlog Items from Sprint 7 in Sprint 8.
There is nothing wrong. The Development Team will present all Product Backlog Items selected for Sprint 7 at the end of the Sprint.
The Development Team may forecast less overall work in Sprint 8.
Stakeholders will encourage the Development Team to estimate better during the Sprint 8 Planning Meeting

The Development Team carries over incomplete Sprint Backlog Items from Sprint 7 to Sprint 8 and monitors the Sprint 8 burn-down chart. As soon as deviation from trends is detected, the Development Team works with the Product Owner to negociate remaining work.

question: How often should an automated build be executed ?

answers.text: Once per day.
Whenever a developer suspects there is a bug in the system.
As often as possible, and certainly prior to the end of the sprint.
Whenever new or changed code is checked into version control.

question: In what ways does the Development Team contribute to refining the Product Backlog ? (Choose all that apply)

answers.text: They don't. The Scrum Master and the Product Owner are responsible for Product Backlog refinement.

They ask questions in order to clarify the intent of Product Backlog Items
They don't. The Development Team is only responsible for priorizing technical work.

question: When does the Development Team show their work to the Product Owner ?

answers.text: Whenever the Product Owner asks
Anytime the Development Team needs feedback from the Product Owner
During the Sprint Review

question: Which of the following is required by Scrum ?

answers.text: Sprint Retrospective
Members must stand up at the Daily Scrum
Sprint Burndown Chart
Release planning
All of the above

question: A Development Team is blocked by an impediment in the middle of the Sprint. The impediment is outside the Development Team's control. What should the Development Team do ?

answers.text: Immediatly raise the issue to the Scrum Master.
Cancel the Sprint.
Stop using Scrum.
Complete the work that can be done on as much scope as possible and complete the rest during "hardening" sprints at the end of the release.
Complete the work that can be done on as much scope as possible and use the Sprint Review to plan the rest with stakeholders

question: Which is a benefit of refactoring code ?

answers.text: To keep the code moving.
To have all code in a single file for easy printing and code reviews.

To improve readability and maintainability.

question: Which are four attributes of a good bug report ? (Choose 4 answers)

Explains some new system functionality desired

question: How should Product Backlog Items be chosen when multiple Scrum Teams work from the same Product Backlog ?

answers.text: The Scrum Team with the highest velocity pulls Product Backlog Items first.
The Product Owner decides.
The Development Team pull in work in agreement with the Product Owner.
The Product Owner should provide each team with its own Product Backlog.
Each Scrum Team takes an equal number of items.

question: At Sprint Planning, the Development Team has NO clear standard to meet for releasable software. What should the Development Team do ?

answers.text: Create a unique completion checklist for each item in the Sprint.
As a Development Team, specify a shared definition of done.

question: Cyclomatic complexity is a metric for :

question: Which topics should be discussed in the Sprint Review ?

question: Which metric is LEAST useful when measuring code maintainability ?

question: Database design must be complete before coding starts to ensure a solid foundation.

answers.text: true
false

question: Is it a good idea to follow each automated build with the execution of automated tests ?

An automated test suite to verify functionality delivered in previous iterations.

question: What are two reasons to use mock objects in unit tests? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: The behavior of a given object can be emulated to the system undertest
They are machine-generated and eliminate the need to write code by hand
Isolating a particular system component for controlled testing
To decrease cyclomatic complexity
TDD is impossible without them

question: Who is responsible for engaging the stakeholders?

answers.text: The business analyst
The team manager
The project manager
The Development Team
The Product Owner

question: When can a Development Team cancel a Sprint?

answers.text: When the selected Product Backlog items for the Sprint become unachievable.
It can‘t. Only Product Owners can cancel Sprints.
When the Product Owner is absent too often.
When functional expectations are not well understood.
When a technical dependency cannot be resolved.

question: The Product Owner must release each Increment to production.

answers.text: Whenever the product is free of defects.
Without exception.
To make sure the Development Team is done every Sprint.
When it makes sense.

question: When should a Sprint Goal be created?

answers.text: It must be established before Sprint Planning in orderto begin planning.
At anytime during the Sprint.
During Sprint Planning.
A Sprint Goal is not mandatory in Scrum.
It should have been created in the previous Sprint during Product Backlog refinement.

question: What does it mean to say that an event has a time-box?

answers.text: The event must happen at a set time.
The event must take at least a minimum amount of time.
The event must happen by a given time.
The event can take no more than a maximum amount of time.

question: What is the accountability of the Product Owner during Sprint 0?

answers.text: Gathering, eliciting, and analyzing the requirements that will be inserted into the Product Backlog.
Determine the composition ofthe Development Teams so they have the capacity to deliver the completed forecast.
Make the complete project plan to commit date, budget and scope to the stakeholders.
Make sure enough Product Backlog items are refined to fill the first 3 Sprints.
There is no such thing as Sprint 0.

question: Which Scrum Value is affected by a lack of trust in the Scrum Team?

answers.text: Respect
Focus
Openness
Commitment
Courage
All of the above

question: What is Technical Debt?

answers.text: The average time or money a Scrum Team spends per Sprint on bug fixes.
A term representing the eventual consequences of poor technical choices.
Code that has not been commented or documented.
The money an organization owes to tool and hardware vendors.

question: Which of the following two best describe a ready Product Backlog item? (Choose two answers)

answers.text: It has been changed from unready to ready status in the tracking tool.
It is a complete user story with all its components.
It has been fully described in the User Requirements analysis.
It can most likely be 'done' within one Sprint.
It is well understood by the Development Team and Product Owner at the Sprint Planning.

question: What relationship does Scrum have to development practices?

answers.text: Scrum has no relationship to development practices.
Scrum requires all development practices.
Scrum requires specific development practices.
Scrum is complemented by development practices.

question: Every Scrum Team must have a Product Owner and Scrum Master.

answers.text: False. A Scrum Master is only required when asked for by the Development Team.
True. Each must be 100% dedicated to the Scrum Team.
True. Outcomes are affected by their participation and availability.
False. A Product Owner can be replaced by a business analyst in the Development Team.

question: Which of the following best describes Continuous Integration?

answers.text: A software development practice that continuously integrates feedback from users into software design.
A software development practice where members of a Development Team all work on the same computer to ensure a common code base.
A software development practice used by integration teams to create best practice branching and merging strategies.
A software development practice where members of a Development Team integrate and verify their work frequently, often multiple times each day, to detect integration errors as quickly as possible.

question: Which two things should the Development Team do during the first Sprint? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: Develop at least one piece of functionality.
Analyze, design, and describe the complete architecture and infrastructure.
Analyze, describe, and document the requirements forthe subsequent Sprints.
Make up a plan forthe rest ofthe project.
Create an Increment of potentially releasable software.

question: When is the Sprint Backlog created?

answers.text: During the Sprint
Prior to the Sprint Planning meeting
At the beginning ofthe project
During the Sprint Planning meeting

question: When is a Sprint over?

answers.text: When the Product Owner says it is done.
When all the tasks are completed.
When all Product Backlog items meet their definition of "Done."
When the time-box expires.

question: Which of the following are true about the length of the Sprint? (Choose 2 answers)

answers.text: Sprint length is determined during Sprint Planning, and should be long enough to make sure the Development Team can deliver what is to be accomplished in the upcoming Sprint
All Sprints must be 1 month or less.
The length of the Sprint should be proportional to the work that is done in between Sprints.
Sprint length is determined during Sprint Planning, and should hold the time it will take to code the planned features in the upcoming Sprint, but does not include time for any testing.
It is best to have Sprints of consistent length throughout a development effort.

question: Which phrase best describes a Product Owner?

answers.text: Value optimizer
Team manager
Go-between between development team and customers
Requirements engineer

question: The Product Backlog is ordered by:

answers.text: Risk, where safer items are at the top, and riskier items are at the bottom.
Importance, where the most important items are at the top at all times.
Items are randomly arranged.
Size, where small items are at the top and large items are at the bottom.

question: Which three purposes does the definition of “Done” serve? (Choose 3 answers)

answers.text: Describe the work that must be done before the Sprint is allowed to end.
Create a shared understanding of when work is complete.
lncrease transparency.
Describe the purpose, objective, and time-box of each Scrum event.
Guide the Development Team on how many Product Backlog items to select for the Sprint
